channel.title: Oliver Palm
channel.description: Recent content in Categories on Oliver Palm

item.title: Miso Salmon
item.description:
• Prep time: 10 min
  • Cook time: 20-30 min
  • Servings: 4

Ingredients

  • 600-800 g salmon
  • 4 Tbsp miso (Any type seems to work)
  • 2 Tbsp sake
  • 2 Tbsp mirin
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 0.5 Tbsp toasted sesame oil

Directions

  1. Mix all of the ingredients for the marinade in a bowl
  2. Add the salmon to a container, spread the marinade over the salmon, put the container in the fridge for - a minimum of - 30 minutes
  3. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius
  4. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or untile desired doneness

item.title: Project
item.description:
Server, Website, and Emails

To host my websites and my personal email service I use a VPS provided by DartNode. All of my personal websitess are built with HUGO, for a introduction/tutorial on HUGO I highly recommend Luke Smith’s video.

item.title: Software & Config
item.description:
Window Managers VS Desktop Enviorments

Having used Windows for most of my life I though a desktop enviorment worked just fine, but I nonetheless hade a feeling that one could do better. This feeling lead me to look for alternatives (window managers) where I found Hyprland.

Honestly no complaints. It works out of the box, easy to configure, looks greate with minimal changes, and is a joy to use. My personal config file can be found here.

Editors

Much ink has been spiled franticaly arguing why one editor is objectively better than another, so let me not add wood to an eternaly roaring flame. I use vim (nvim for the pedantic), and more specificaly I use NvChad. It works like a charm and has all the features I need.

Work in Progress
